title: A decent free Subsonic app...but UltraSonic is still somewhat better
comment: For free, I cannot complain.  I wanted an app to connect to my Ampache server via HTTPS and this worked.  Bandwidth limitation to help save some data usage on mobile is a huge plus!  It has a much better interface than then any other free Subsonic apps, and above and beyond any native Ampache apps (mostly all dead anyway).  Still, it is not without its limitations.  The audio focus is way off.  Not only does it mute the music when navigation kicks in, but it mutes the navigation audio as well.  Kind of useless at this point.  Gapless playback is not available (the first attempt to play streaming ogg files will just stop and skip to the next song after 20 seconds; would have to skip back to play correctly...just got annoying after a while).  It's a good app for those that don't really expect or need too much.  But, it lacks quite a bit that Ultrasonic (also free...but dead project) does better (list by album title, gapless playback, correct audio focus, and being able to list my video catalog and play them).  Since the Ultrasonic project looks like it's dead, I'm really hoping this one will catch up.

title: What can I do about the reboots?
comment: This has been my go-to method for playing music on my mobile devices for years.  I love the server product (purchased long ago), and the mobile app has always been great.  However, since I upgraded my phone (T-Mobile Galaxy S4 - M919) to Kit Kat the app has been unusable for me.  It works for a few tracks and then spontaneously reboots my phone.  This happens when using wifi or mobile data connections.  I've cleaned all of my settings, did fresh installs, factory reset my phone, formatted my SD card (although Subsonic is using the internal storage), etc., and I still get the reboots.  I see that others are having this problem as well.  I'd really like to find some information about how to resolve this.  I rely on my Subsonic server heavily for music.  This will be a 5-star review when I can get this resolved.

title: Network Error on 3G with home server
comment: Home server setup was difficult, but eventually I did get it set up.  Since I was home, I was using my WiFi connection.  Music streamed fine.  Since I really want to use with my 3G service,  I turned off the WiFi and enabled my 3G connection.  When I do this, it fails to connect to the home server.  However, I am able to connect to the subsonic demo server over a 3G connection as well as the WiFi connection. This is not a suitable replacement for AudioGalaxy.

title: Does Not Actually Stream!?!
comment: SubSonic doesn't truly "stream" anything - it must cache the entire track before playing anything (unlike the now defunct AudioGalaxy). Don't get me wrong - everything functions correctly once it has cached a few tracks, but calling it a music streaming app is a huge stretch.  Major disappointment.

title: Great App, but ads? C'mon...
comment: This app has been fantastic in the past. (Usually) Works great with some issues connecting to my home server (only four attempts before timeout? really?)... However, I paid for the lifetime license in the server (which is supposed to come with a custom URL that has never worked) in order to get the ability to stream to the phone app... Now they've changed the phone app to be ALSO ad-supported? I understand the need to make money, and had this been the case all along it would be fine... but changing it and requiring people who've already paid for the support to have to then pay more to remove the ads? Ridiculous. At least give those of us who've paid in YEARS ago to keep the project going a credit so we can get rid of the ads ourselves or *something*. No contact at all from the developer about this is further disappointing. Honestly, thinking of switching completely to Google Play or Spotify as a result - then I won't need to have my PC on at home all the time...

title: Don't donate to this project.
comment: Having used Subsonic for about a year and a half, I have seen more and more "one time donations" get added on to this project in order for it to be usable. This will not be the last time you "donate" if you wish to continue using Subsonic. Given Subsonic's use of the GPL license, requiring involuntary donations is not only ethically ambiguous, but also legally ambiguous.

title: The only solution

AudioGalaxy Replacement!

If this keeps up I won't be "donating" to keep the app, and will check out HomeDJ. Other than the skips, I love this app, so it's kind of a shame.

title: Latest versions a disappointment
comment: Up until the "facelift" version (3.5) I gave this app 5 stars. It's still great, but I have experienced several problems with the latest versions and the developer has not released any updates in the last 3 months to address the issues. Here are the problems I'm having: 1. Player screen now includes ads. Not a major issue, but annoying considering I already donated. 2. Library can get out of sync with server and display the wrong artist's albums (I tap artist A, see artist B's albums) 3. Audio often stutters and stalls at the beginning of tracks, even on tracks that have already downloaded completely. This is the most annoying, because I have to switch to the app (often while driving) to restart the track. That said, I really like this app and I wish the developer would take the time to polish the latest version. This app is still my favorite way to take all the music on my home computer with me everywhere I have a network connection.

title: Good app, gone bad.
comment: Still won't allow you to play videos without using the browser (which is bad since flash is no longer supported on Android). Not only that, but DSub is based on the same code and is half the price!  I will also be switching to supersonic in protest,  even though I donated to get a license key for the server .
Had it before, but switched to HomeDJ Music player had subsonic before, but was turned off by luck of features.   I like HomeDJ music player better.

Practically every music streaming app even beyondpod(an app I use for podcasts) all have lock screen control which allow you control playback without having to unlock the device. Also there is a bug that deactivates the service for a while. Almost that it chooses when it wants to work. Will update review once these issues have been resolved.

I fire through my device, pick an album, then go to click Select All, and just as I do this, an ad pops up and now I'm not listening to my music anymore.  I'm being advertised at.  I want nothing but to roll back to the previous version.  It's free, it works.  I found 4.6 server, reinstalled that, and now I'm moving over to DSub because the new interface just wore me out.  I assumed when I paid for the server that I wouldn't be harassed, at all, ever.  Then this.    Anyway, DSub works great.

OFFLINE PLAYLISTS

title: Ads for long time users...
comment: Subsonic is a great server; but, now, after having a working app (which we have to enable by donating to the server project), you're forcing ads upon us if we don't pay a second time?  I expect I can join many others in saying I won't update.  I will not pay twice to use an app I already own without nagging ads.

title: Developer addressed recent ad concerns
comment: Thank you to the developer for addressing the recent advertising concerns.  Sindre did right by his community and for that I thank him.  Sure things could have been handled differently but mistakes happen.  As for the app it works great.  Thank you.

title: Double dipping
comment: As others have pointed out, I had to pay to use mobile apps with the Server, and now ads were introduced into the app to get users to pay again. DSub is a much better app with lockscreen controls on ICS and later and no ads. It's not free but it's cheaper than removing ads from this latest version and worth it with the lockscreen controls.

title: Not cool.
comment: You already advertise Subsonic as a free application when in reality it's not; you have to buy a license in order to use the actual useful features. Or in your terms, "donate." I bit the bait then because this was a useful application; I gave you $15 when I could have given you just $5, or mayhaps even less.  And now you give us the middle finger by making us pay for your application AGAIN. This application needs to be paid for two times. One just to be able to use it (which is a cost you are not at all up front about), and one to get rid of the ads, which obnoxiously obscure the cover art. You pretend that both this client and the server are free when they're really not, and that's deplorable.  I don't see any reason to put more money into your greedy fingertips when I can grab a 64GB microSDXC for $64 and have ALL my music stored locally for the forseeable future, without having to deal with the long wait times between simply navigating folders, trying to load playlists, or simply trying to download the next song.

title: Worthwhile purchase
comment: Money well spent to help with continued development. Offline caching is exactly what subsonic needed, and the holo theme rocks!

title: Ads! Yuk!

title: Pay to remove adds?

title: Ads? Really?

title: Would be fantastic but...
comment: UI is very nice. App does everything I want for music, but lacks in app viewing of video (or at least the file formats I have) and requires flash (for video). Would be more tolerable by allowing the app to download video to a specific directory. If it played video in app (without flash), definitely five star.

title: Nice App But Now Ads? Come On! Really?!
comment: Great app, very flexible. Free on server side is awesome. Paying for the mobile app was one thing, fine, I get that, but to then make you pay an additional fee for ad removal... App is awesome, but giving Sindre 1 star for being a douche. If you're not getting enough income, increase the price of the app, don't make all users who already paid suffer...
Pay again?

title: Now with ads - even if you bought a license!

comment: Obnoxious ads now appear in the middle of the screen (over the album art... are you serious,Subsonic?) unless you pay a premium to remove them. Things is, those of us past the trial period have ALREADY paid for Subsonic, and now they're trying to squeeze even more money out of us. title: Ads!?

title: Ads? After I've already paid you? Get bent...
comment: When you're already paying for the server software in order for the mobile version to function in the first place, serving ads is a slap in the face. I've been using Subsonic for years, and now I'm looking for an alternative. Ditch this garbage...

title: Shady practice, no quality
comment: I paid for the server license which allowed "streaming to mobile devices" after the trial period. It doesn't seem right to get demand another fee affecting mobile and/or customers that paid prior to this release. I guess it's ok be cause ads don't really affect the functionality of the app and it's not a breach of contract. Now... the app itself is buggy just like the server is. I just had to, without a good reason, again uninstall the server because the 503 error about Jetty server came back. It's a long documented problem that has no solution other than uninstall server and install it back (installing over doesn't work). Now that there is no flash player available on Jelly Bean streaming videos is gone. Since this is where Android devices are going it would be nice if there was a replacement functionality. Other than that the updated app FCs on me all the time. So I'm being asked to pay for facelift I actually don't like, FCs and lack of decent video streaming. After all using flash for that is a hack, not a legitimate functionality. On the phone video controls in flash player are not meant to be used with fingers. It's a lot better to dump videos into Dropbox and stream.

title: Doesn't need ad support
comment: The new version looks good, but having ads has made me uninstall and use the older version.

title: GREAT update, worth the wait!
comment: Despite the ads direction (please support dev on apps you enjoy and use often) we waited a long time for this update, and it looks great, works great for my huge mp3 collection, and I'm pleased the dev continues to improve the server and android app. Nothing compares favorably to the funtionality and support offered by this project, highly recommended.

title: Double charging for ad removal.

title: Hundreds of GBs of Music Anywhere You Go

I feel there could be more options for us to pick for UI but she work's lovely for my Moto Defy. Do you appreciate all the work that went into the android Client? Don't be a stifler and show some love: Give them 3 bucks... Jeez.

title: Fantastic app. Easily my favorite.
comment: Sounds like a lot of people are having issues with the ads, but I'm not one of them.  I installed the new version (having previously paid for the app rights like the others) and I am not seeing any ads at all.  I'll keep an eye on things, and update if something changes, but for right now I'm having no problems.    As for the update, I like it pretty well.  Navigation is much easier, cleaner and smoother in my opinion and the whole app just feels snappier.  While I like the transparency of the widget, I have to admit I liked the previous version's widget a little better.  Mainly, I would like to see the larger album art back for the widget.    Overall, a nice upgrade.  I'll admit, however, my review would be less glowing if I were being forced to pay again for ad removal, as others seem to be.

title: New version sucks

The new version looks nicer but I'm a little upset because I paid for the server and now I have to pay for the app as well to get rid of ads that never existed before. Its ridiculous. It didn't even add any new features over the old one besides the look. I'm sticking with the old one.

I donated $20 to start, another $5 now... hmmm, less than a dollar a month so far, and I never have to pay another dime if I don't want to.  Not bad for something that I've spent a total of zero minutes trying to develop or code on my own.  THANK YOU!

Keep up the good work !

comment: Classic bait and switch. Reel you in with promises of software freedom, then the server shuts down after a month, after lock-in. Pay ransom.  Now same with the client-- it's pay up or else. Total scumbag move. Time for a serious fork.   DO NOT DOWNLOAD

title: Awesome!!!!
comment: love open source :) amazing product!

I now have to pay to remove ads, to listen to the music I've paid for, which I've paid for the bandwidth to upload them onto the server I paid for, which gets streamed to my phone using the bandwidth I paid for, using the subsonic server app which incidentally, I've paid for???  The update looks great but doesn't actually do anything new.

title: Great app but add removal to expensive

title: Great app

title: Highly disappointing...
comment: After paying for the server to stream, I now have to pay to get the client ad free. Seems that Sindre has decided to go anti-user on both ends of the deal. The UI update is nice, but I'm going to keep running with the old version for now.

title: Pretty good app.
comment: Screw uploading all my music to Google. But it has a few bugs. Player skips occasionally while downloading. No gapless playback. Switching servers stops the player. I have not upgraded to the new version due to the ads. I feel it should have been handled much more openly. I am going to give DSub a try, which I just found out about in the comments here. It is an alternative to connecting to my home subsonic server.

title: Not impresed
comment: Updated on Nexus 7 now errors all the time :(

title: Video Please
comment: Fix video streaming, then I'll pay the additional fee.  A real upgrade would get rid of the dependency on flash. This release still tries to play video in a browser, so it doesn't work on nexus 7. Please let us offload the stream to a media player.
Paid for upgrade (AKA ad removal) but app still doesn't fix issue where hitting Play Now on an item in the library instead just plays the first item in the existing queue. (HTC Rezound)

title: Fantastic.
comment: Having my entire 400 gb music collection available to me anywhere, on any device is just awesome.  Love that I have my own server and can control how it runs without being subject to the vagaries of a third party. Great developer support. The new version of the Android app is a big improvement, with larger album art and simpler navigation. But... needs to allow for longer track titles. (I'm enough of a fan that I'll overlook the sudden addition of ads.)

title: Most expensive ad removal on the Market
comment: Great app,  but you have to pay for the server *and* the app now to not see ads.   A bit annoying,  since I "donated" in the first place to be able to use the app,  now I'm getting squeezed for more cash. Oh,  and it's nearly 5 bucks to remove ads,  hidden as an in app purchase.   Taking away one star.

title: Yet again, a great product
comment: Great work Sindre - a quick play and a very solid product.  Looks great, is fast and responsive, and I have yet to find any bugs...which is a sign of a great developer.  Much more user friendly now too.  Totally cool with the ads and upgrade option, have bought ad free - but I think the price could have been about half that to make it easier to swallow.  Remember everyone, there are two software products (server and client) you use, and until now you have only paid for one!  Both need to be developed and maintained!  And I want to keep seeing these quality updates.  That said, agree with those who have requested lock screen controls would be a great plus.  Would also like to see the Holo type gestures (swipe left and right to change between tabs I think is more useful then skipping on the player screen when the buttons are right there anyway).  Maybe lock the control buttons at the bottom too (or have a setting to lock them there).  Highly recommend this app and server!!

title: Being charged twice
comment: Pretty scummy to make us pay to remove ads when we all ready paid for lifetime server licence. I'm a developer my self and would never treat my customers with this kind of contempt. Either charge for the app or charge for the server, not both, and certainly don't change the model for your existing customers. Scummy.

title: Disappointed
comment: This is a great App - don't get me wrong.  But the latest update with ads is a terrible move.  After paying for the server (which was the only way you could use the app), I'm disappointed up upgrade to the latest version and suddenly there is ads and we have to pay to remove those as well.   This is at best disingenuous and I'm not impressed.

title: Just became perfect
comment: The new, slick UI and the fixing of the bluetooth disconnection bug in ICS just got rid of the two remaining niggles I had with this app. It is now exactly the music player I need. It's fast, it looks good, I can play my own music where-ever I have 3g signal. It sorts my collection according to how I want it sorted (as defined by my server), it can cache songs offline... It's bloody brilliant.  I do agree that it's a little bit cheeky to charge existing users to remove ads, on top of the donation charge for using the server in mobile mode, but Sindre has obviously put a lot of work into this update so I don't begrudge a couple of quid. He gets four starts instead of five though for that reason :)

title: Great App!
comment: Downloaded and works great on my GS3! New app has adds and you have to pay to get rid of them... But I love SubSonic and the server is great so I paid for the app add removal. Dont feel bad for support the team.

title: Why ads?
comment: I've been using this app for a year now, and have been very happy with it. The new version contains ads, which makes me use the older version. I've already paid for the server, I don't think I should have to pay for removing the ads from the app as well.

title: Great update.
comment: Excellent copy of Google music interface. Best functionality + Googles best UI in the world. Much better than Google music overall. Works off WHS and its fast. Multiple users CAN listen the same collection. Fast reading of WHS folders 9000+ songs.

title: Great update, even with new cost
comment: Love the new app! One feature request: allow for random within music, video and both.   I don't mind paying another ~$5 for this great app and software. But I do think the news of the charge could have been handled better.

title: Ask a vet
comment: Why don't world war 2 vets like the red cross? Because they started charging them for doughnuts. The price was reasonable but when you take away a free service and start charging people get upset. The red Cross stopped charging for doughnuts shortly after but it definitely left an impression on the soldiers...

title: Great app, but lose the ads
comment: Great app, love the update. However, I've already donated for the Subsonic server, I don't feel I should have to donate again. Plus the price is steep. $4.44 USD? Ads are a plague. Fortunately AdAway takes care of those.

title: A must have for a music enthusiast!
comment: For any power user, this is simply your best option for personal music streaming.

title: Surprise! Ads!
comment: Ads all of a sudden? I would actually be OK with this IF the app supported the JB lock screen and notification controls, it doesn't. Make that work and I'll be glad to pay to remove ads. The new update does look really nice however.

title: Nothing Else Like This, Even After All These Years
comment: Siren songs like Google Music and Amazon promise cloud and 'music matching'/listen anywhere/anytime ubiquity, but with serious limitations. Subsonic DELIVERS, and grows to fit needs well beyond those siren song services. New App updates are appreciated, and ad free version cost me a whopping $2.76, which actually may short the dev of money, as I assume ad-support brings in some serious cash (otherwise why would nearly all apps on Play have ad-supported free versions?). We always donated/paid for a license to USE APPS past 30 days, the server itself has always, and continues to be, free, so everyone can stop with the 'I paid for the server already' whinging...it's always been free. There are alternatives to the standard android app, and iOS apps too, if it truly bugs anyone to pay $2.76 for an ad-free version of the standard app.

title: Great app. Ads suck.
comment: Love subsonic. Paid for ad removal.

title: Lost a star for Ads!
comment: Like others have said, we have already paid for the server app so it seems a bit rich to now charge us again for the client app (especially because we're the ones who have already donated/paid rather than new customers).  The app itself is great and has never let me down but I'm ranking this down one star because of the ads.

title: It's Really Good -- It Used to be Better
comment: I've been using Subsonic for about eight months.  When it works, it's great.  But getting there can be a drag.  Probably the worst part about Subsonic for me is the awful load times when dealing with "large"(ish) playlists.  It just crawls, and retries, and crawls, and retries... until finally it gets it.  It's so annoying when I want to load up my big mix and it takes nearly five minutes to get it going.  The only other negative for me is the horrific widget style.  I back up the apk, edit the graphics in the package, repack, sign, copy to phone and install.  It's a process but it's worth it not to have my main screen all jacked looking.  *** Update 10/18/2012*** Ads?!?  Are you kidding me?  Nearly all users have already dropped a decent amount of money on the server but now we're all asked to fork over nearly $4.50 for the app?  The whole draw was free app, test out the free trial of the server, than buy the server portion if you like.  Now everyone who paid for it has to put up with ads or fork over more money. title: Sweet!   I like the idea of MyCloud.
comment: I'm truly pleased with the setup and performance of this tool.   I was looking for something that would allow me wireless access to ALL my music and video content without having to go through an online music storage site.   I just don't see the point of having to upload your music when you can play it from its current location.  Apple owners should love the fact that a one time payment gets them online access to all their music without being confined to Apple's walled garden, as I believe Apple charges an annual fee for ICloud music access.  Port forwarding issues caused a slight delay since I had some initial trouble accessing my music beyond my home wireless network, but I quickly realized I was using the internal IP address instead of the external one.   I did setup a different port number than the default and since I already have a web address through my WHS I just have to add the port address at the end of my WHS address to get access to the Subsonic login.  I've loaded this app on both my phone and tablet and have enjoyed the freedom from ads for two weeks now.  I don't use apps like Pandora, etc. simply because I have gigs of new and old music I know I'll like.

title: Dear John
comment: Sorry mate, QoS on your router has zero relevance. Traffic to LAN based devices don't even go through your router. And your ISP isnt honouring any marking you are doing anyway - why should it, wrong direction! In any case QoS would only be useful on a stream. In spite of the name, this app does NOT stream. It is a straightforward http bulk download, and another thread simply handles playback in parallel... which us precisely what you want. You would have a very poor experience if you really tried streamjng!

title: Great app but full of bugs and usability problems
comment: On one hand, this program (and the accompanying server) is a godsend for me. However, it is full of user-interface issues and bugs:  The search screen doesn't remember search results after you move to another screen. Songs in the playlist cannot be reordered (only shuffled). Adding multiple songs to the playlist from different directories  at once creates "null" entries in the playlist that stop playback. Folder contents is not batched or cached so every "change directory" operation takes time while the server is contacted. Moving to another screen makes the app forget where you are in the folder view. The playlist has no operations for selection or "remove songs above" or "remove songs below".  In short, this app has huge promise but its user interface has a long, long way to go.
